newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela says demand for CANTV topping $890 mln.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela says demand for CANTV topping $890 mln.

text.p: Total buy orders for shares in Venezuelan telephone company CANTV have reached $890 million, Venezuela's Investment Fund (FIV) said.
European buy orders are at $350-400 million and orders from the United States are at some $300 million.
Venezuelan orders are currently about $100 million, which could rise to $130 million once buy orders from the interior of the country are included, the FIV said in a press release.
With 50 million shares reserved for local markets, some 25,000 Venezuelans have so far registered for the sale -- a figure that is expected to rise further, the release added.
The government is offering 289 million shares in the company on national and international markets in one of the biggest placements in Latin America this year.
The reference price for the shares currently ranges between $3.07 and $3.50, but may rise above that once the price is finally settled on November 21, FIV President Alberto Poletto has said.
